result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Trevor Quaderer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request to Issue Civil Judgment for Court Obligations and/or Restitution received and forwarded to ALi. os

Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
No action taken.

Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
The case is calendared for a jury trial today.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
 Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 7 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 14 months with the following conditions:

- Complete a course in anger management.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
Probation review hearing calendared for 11/20/2015 at 01:30 p.m.

Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties inform the court that this case is continued to trial on 08/19/2015 at 08:30 a.m..
All offers are revoked.
Defendant has an arrest warrant on him in Case 15cm2028 and was taken into custody.

Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM023850  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/10/2015

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.   
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with ALEXIS C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
